**<sub><sub>![P2 Badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/P2-yellow?style=flat)</sub></sub>  Apply calibration_state in auto-detect configs**

When `--all` is used, `run_all_kernels()` relies on the base configâ€™s auto-detect mode (no `plugins` list), but `generate_temp_config()` only injects `calibration_state` if a `plugins` list already exists. That means `cortex run --all --state <file>` silently drops the state and trainable kernels receive `NULL`, which can make them fail init or run uncalibrated. If `--state` is meant to work with auto-detect, you either need to synthesize a plugins list (or reject `--state` with `--all`) instead of ignoring it.
